body_content.explanation: the act of introducing laws that allow a government to control an industry's activities again after a period of letting the industry make its own rules, or an occasion on which this is done:
examples: The aviation authority has argued for limited re-regulation of the airline industry, which was deregulated in 1978.
The president has promised to introduce a period of reregulation to avoid the risks that many in the financial sector have been taking.
